alert.note: Alert for Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 30 at 1:27AM CST until November 30 at 1:45AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CST FOR CENTRAL WALTHALL COUNTY... At 125 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Salem, or near Kokomo, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. At 1254 AM CST damage was reported along Interstate 55 just south of Magnolia. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Walthall County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
